issue.title: [CF 209] Various Bugs
issue.body:
First let me thank you for adding the functionality I had asked you for (sorting unit cooldowns). I'm really looking forward to testing this feature. However with the most recent update(s) a whole multitude of issues seems to have appeared. The first thing I saw after logging in and trying to create a new icon, when the icon still had "icon type" selected, was the options from apparently three different menues stacked upon each other. This however quickly disappeared after I had switched the icon type. The second issue I found was after selecting an icon TellMeWhen would keep the layout of the icon even after closing the icon and opening another such as a meta icon. I found those bugs withing the first three minutes, I'll be adding reports in the comments if I find more.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #209 | Raw

comments.body:
r83 update r86+ will got lua error.
You can update r85 first and login once, after do this, update last version TMW will fix menu error.

Edited May 22, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

Bug #1
If you choose any sound in default list, Sound Play does work.
Must be use the custom sound looks like "Interface\Addons\Prat-3.0\sounds\Xylo.ogg".
TMW Version:r88


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

@lsjyzjl: Go

What is the Lua error that you are getting?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

The sound error is the only one that I am able to reproduce (although i haven't tested the upgrade straight from r83)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Screen for the first bug: http://h-4.abload.de/img/wowscrnshot_052211_171eruz.jpg

Screen for the second bug: http://h-4.abload.de/img/wowscrnshot_052211_1709pkl.jpg - after opening one icon menu http://h-4.abload.de/img/wowscrnshot_052211_170qoqf.jpg - after rightclicking another icon the menu from the first icon persists


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

The only way that the first bug can be happening is if there is a Lua error occurring. The other bug is also probably the result of an error. Make sure that you are using the latest version (r88) and enable Lua errors (Interface Options > Game tab > Help > Display Lua Errors)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

-.-I forgot to copy lua error.
I update r83 to r86, got a lua error.
It's only happen once, when I overwrite r85 and reloadui, lua error not happen again.
I try to reinstall r83 and login once, overwrite r86, login wow. NO Lua error. Orz


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

@Cybeloras: Go I try to overwrite my old savedvariables.-.-
r83->r84(ok)
r84->r85(ok)
r85->r86(ERROR)
It's only happen once when first login. Reloadui or Relogin will fix this error.

/sleep
/bye

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

@lsjyzjl: Go

Does upgrading straight to r89 fix this?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

I tested all version from r83 to r89
r83 SavedVariables: ->r84(ok) ->r85(ok) ->r86(error) ->r87(ok) ->r88(ok) ->r89(ok)
Old SavedVariables: ->r84(ok) ->r85(ok) ->r86(error) ->r87(ok) ->r88(ok) ->r89(ok)

It only happens in r86.
Orz (Sorry, Please Forgive Me!) T.T

BTW, r89 "sound play" has been fixed.


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

I'm not too worried about it then. The error was in the upgrade settings to r86, but it has since been fixed.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
